== Main Inclusion Report for Librsync ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libr/librsync, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Install dependency of rdiff-backup, used by Keep
 0. ''Security:''
** No CVE entries.
** No Secunia history.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** No showstopper <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?which=src&data=librsync&archive=no&version=&dist=unstable|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** Good maintenance in Debian.
** Upstream not very active, but it's Martin Pool so we can always poke him
** No critical bugs in <nowiki>[[https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=56125&atid=479439|sourceforge upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Standard debhelper, basic patch system
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.
